properties.Title: Lion-Shaped Bibru
properties.Descriptio:
Lion-Shaped Bibru
Anatolian, Old Assyrian Colony Period, mid-20th-19th century BCE
From R (Turkey)
Painted terracotta
H. 19.5 cm (7 11/16 in.)
Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Antikensammlung, V.I. 592

properties.Title: Rhyton in the Form of a Lion
properties.Descriptio:
Rhyton in the Form of a Lion
Assyrian, 1900-1700 BCE
From Kültepe (Turkey)
Terracotta
H. 20.5 x L. 21.5 cm
Musée du Louvre, AM 1517

properties.Title: Bull Head Rhyton
properties.Descriptio:
Bull Head Rhyton
Minoan, 14th-13th century BCE
From Karpathos (Greece)
Painted terracotta
H. 15.2 cm (6 in.)
British Museum, Donated by W. R. Paton, 1887,0501.6

properties.Title: Ram Head Rhyton
properties.Descriptio:
Ram Head Rhyton
Mycenaean, 14th-13th century BCE
From Ras Shamra-Ugarit/Minet el-Beida (Syria)
Painted terracotta
H. 21.5 x Diam. 16 cm (8 7/16 x 6 5/16 in.)
Musée du Louvre, AO 19932

properties.Title: Askos in the Form of a Bull
properties.Descriptio:
Askos in the Form of a Bull
Cypriot, 14th-13th century BCE
From Tomb 15, Maroni (Cyprus)
Painted terracotta
H. 17 x L. 24 cm (6 11/16 x 9 7/16 in.)
British Museum, Excavated by the British Museum, 1898,1201.142

properties.Title: Reproduction of a Minoan Bull Head Rhyton
properties.Descriptio:
Reproduction of a Minoan Bull Head Rhyton
Early 20th century (reproduction of ca. 1625-1470 BCE original)
Polychrome plaster
Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Gift of Mrs. Schuyler Van Rensselaer, 1926.32.3

properties.Title: Wine Ewer (He) in the Form of a Standing Duck
properties.Descriptio:
Wine Ewer (He) in the Form of a Standing Duck
Chinese, Zhou Dynasty, Warring States, 475-221 BCE 
Bronze
H. 20.5 x W. 17 x L. 30.8 cm (8 1/16 x 6 11/16 x 12 1/8 in.)
Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, 
Anonymous gift, 1944.57.4

properties.Title: Stirrup Spout Bottle in the Form of a Puma with Captive Warrior
properties.Descriptio:
Stirrup Spout Bottle in Form of a Puma with Captive 
Warrior
Peruvian, Moche, 200-500 CE 
Painted terracotta
27 x 21 x 19 cm (10 5/8 x 8 1/4 x 7 1/2 in.)
Peabody Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology, 
Friends of the Museum, 16-62-30/F727
